channel.title: Paul the psychic - right again!
channel.description:
Paul the Octopus (hatched January 2008) is a common octopus living in a tank at a Sea Life Centre in Oberhausen, Germany, who is used as an animal oracle to predict the results of football matches, usually international matches in which Germany is playing. He came to worldwide attention with his accurate predictions in the 2010 World Cup.
Spain’s victory Sunday in the World Cup has people wondering how Paul, the “Oracle” octopus predicted the historic win over the Netherlands. And for that matter, how does Paul forecast so many other football matches with such perfection? [b]The mollusk’s on a run with his predictions, scoring a perfect record, 8-for-8, for the 2010 World Cup. Earlier the octopus accurately predicted Germany would beat Uruguay in the World Cup’s third place match on Saturday. Paul also foresaw all four of Germany’s wins and two of its losses.[/b]
Video (note - was taken two days before the final): http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ya85knuDzp8 http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/worldnews/article-1293920/Paul-Psychic-Octopus-World-Cup-2010-oracle-picks-Spain.html
Paul the 'oracle octopus' has proved once and for all that he doesn't crack under pressure by correctly predicting Spain to win the tournament. Spain beat the Netherlands 1-0 in the second half of extra time in an ill-tempered match in the Soccer City stadium outside Johannesburg. The mystic mollusc correctly selected Germany to win the third place play-off against Uruguay, and his national team duly obliged after winning 3-2 in Port Elizabeth.
tl;dr psychic octopus accurately predicts world cup game results Personally, I find it quite amusing :P

item.title: Paul the psychic - right again!
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Bowser jr:

He got a lucky shot with the last one.

I always assumed he bet on both, and then somehow got the winning ticket into her hand and made it seem like she had it all along. I forget exactly how the end went, it’s also possible like you say that he just took a chance, he does abuse chance in his normal routines occasionally.

Read full topic

item.title: Paul the psychic - right again!
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Mopman:

When you see the lengths he went to for the Horse Racing “prediction” you might be more inclined to believe he would waste hours flipping coins

Yes I saw this now (Seeing the program as I watch), and was really expecting some cheap trick since I did not believe somebody would do so much work into something like this.

He got a lucky shot with the last one.

Anyway, this could be a perfect scamming method, give people tips and ask for a little percentage of the profit (When the gain confidence in the scam/system), I don’t see how this could be illegal either, just highly unethical.

Read full topic

item.title: Paul the psychic - right again!
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:24, topic:348505”]See Derren Brown - The System

no really see it anyway derren brown is leet[/quote]
Doing it now, not that I believe him, just want to see his trick.

But I don’t really think he tossed the coin until he got 10 in a row, he must have a better trick.

Read full topic

item.title: Paul the psychic - right again!
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

i was actaully referring to the coin toss, ie if you only see a small window of attempts something that looks very unlikely is actaully within the normal odds

edit: for non derren fanboys; he tossed a coin as many times as it took to get 10 heads in a row (a lot) and made it look as if he only flipped it 10 times. simple stuff, but for some reason everyone overlooks it when looking at everyday events/the news rather than a magician.

Read full topic

item.title: Paul the psychic - right again!
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:24, topic:348505”]See Derren Brown - The System

no really see it anyway derren brown is leet[/quote]

But he predicted what would happen before it happened, and the results were released before every match, not edited together at the end like in The System.

item.title: Paul the psychic - right again!
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

It doesn’t take an idiot to guess that Germany will win against England and Australia.

Perhaps I should elaborate on James Randi’s million dollar challenge. Basically if you can show that paranormal, psychic or supernatural events really happen, you win a million dollars.
If I really had a psychic octopus, I wouldn’t be wasting my time fucking around selling stories to newspapers, I’d be going for the million dollars. I wonder why Paul’s owners haven’t…

Read full topic
